intro: Rhynchospora nervosa var. polystachys, commonly known as the many-stemmed narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, triangular stems and dense clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and have distinct venation, contributing to its botanical identification. It plays an important ecological role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
